titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding support for the recognition of a Liberty Day.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.
Mrs. Morella moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 376.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/18/2000--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) a Liberty Day should be celebrated annually in the United States as a remembrance of both the freedom that Americans were given in the Declaration of Independence and the rights and liberties that Americans were given in the Constitution; and (2) elected and previously-elected representatives of the people who voluntarily give of their time to speak to Americans about those founding documents deserve our thanks.
